meanings.definition: Distinguished by contrasting qualities or features.
meanings.sent1: The two sisters had contradicting styles, making their outfits contradistinctive.
meanings.sent2: The black and white colors on the zebra are contradistinctive, helping it blend into its surroundings.
meanings.sent3: The clown's serious expression was contradistinctive to his colorful costume, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor was contradistinctive to the chaos of the busy city streets.
meanings.sent5: The sweet and sour flavors in the dish created a contradistinctive taste sensation.

meanings.definition: Serving to differentiate by contrasting qualities or features.
meanings.sent1: The unique logo design was contradistinctive, making the brand stand out.
meanings.sent2: The special effects in the movie were contradistinctive, enhancing the viewing experience.
meanings.sent3: The detective's keen observation skills were contradistinctive, solving the mystery in record time.
meanings.sent4: His leadership style was contradistinctive, inspiring his team to achieve great success.
meanings.sent5: The artist's use of light and shadow was contradistinctive, creating a captivating painting.
